reviewText:
I give this a 2 out of 5 stars.
Pros:
Nice graphics style
Humorous
Customizable room and equipment colors (helpful for identifying room-types at a glance!...and for pretties ;)
Nice variety of waiting room/decor items that actually increase patient moods
Interesting & funny diseases
Lots of specialized equipment
Social aspect for staff affects work performance
Cons:
Story" is extremely boring.  The writer thought they were much funnier than they actually were. No way to skip the agonizing story segments either.
Many functions are not intuitive and their use is not explained.  Especially hard to pick up after not playing for quite some time because of this.
Staff do not work effiently with no way to micromanage them to do a better job. i.e.: I had 2 Decontamination rooms because there was an infectious desease plaguing my hospital.  I hired 4 Decontaminators to handle the load.  They all tried to bring patients to the same Decontamination room which kept it backed up.
I would have liked more variety of decor and room customization.
Talking nurse head that gives out missions has that annoying Animal Crossing gibberish and can't be turned off.
Does NOT scratch that "Theme Hospital" itch!!  I still find myself going back to play that after I get frustrated with this game.
I admittedly haven't played this a ton
date: but that's because it is so infuriating and pales in compairison with Theme Hospital.  I REALLY want an update of that game
recommended: but I thought I'd give this a go.  At first I thought it was almost exactly like Theme Hospital...but newer
hoursPlayed: but it quickly falls apart.  The story plays out like a hospital drama/comedy and the idea is solid
voteText: but it drags out and makes me want to poke the writer in the eye.  It's like watching your kid brother try to crack wise

It's hard to tell exactly what you need to do or fix to complete missions/levels.  Most of the time I passed without knowing what I'd fixed.\n"

reviewText:
This isn’t a broken game, or a terrible game, but it's a game that never was great and is even worse now that it is aging.

Pros
Hospital Tycoon isn’t a terrible idea and I think this game at least provides a proof of concept
Cons
The campaign is pretty terrible, but you’ll have to play it to know what to do in sandbox mode.
It's so unrealistic.  Treatment doesn’t occur in the examination room but the pharmacy.  That’s not just unrealistic it's counterintuitive
The gameplay basically consists of a new illness being identified and then the game telling you what new equipment to buy.
The depth is really lacking.  You don’t build out the hospital or decide how much people get paid. All you do is place rooms in a big sandbox and then buy equipment and put it inside.
The game is way too silly in my opinion
The game has a 1080p mode, but everything is just stretched out to make it fit the screen.
The aerial view just shows you the rooms, not any of the people or equipment.
You can’t zoom out far enough.

reviewText:
Please note that I got this game very cheaply as part of a bundle.

The game it set in 3 different hospitals (a series - though the graphics and mechanics are identical in each) with 4 'episodes' in each - in other words, 12 missions. They have tried to implement a story as a way of introducing each mission but this is actually one of the biggest let downs of the game. I'm a story fan but this is truly awful; the attempt at humor is terrible!

That's not to say the game isn't funny - the diseases, the animations etc are all funny and well done but I think they should have just left it at that and removed the story element altogether.

There's a lot wrong with the game. In each mission you have a scenario that you start with and a set of objectives to complete and you can spend your time re-arranging the hospital, improving the decor, training up the staff and getting things running well only to have it all reset at the start of the next mission. This is particularly jarring within a series where each episode is supposed to just be the next shift at the hospital. Still, once you get used to it you won't keep making that mistake again.

There's also some annoyances such as not being able to properly rotate the screen when you get to the edge of the hospital which makes it difficult to place items in those corners. Also the information screens are sorely lacking - it would be nice to see the laziness rating of the staff on the staff summary screen rather than having to click on every individual staff member one by one. And where's the financial info? Absolutely no financial data on profits / expenses etc which is odd.

But despite all of those negatives I'm actually going to give this game a thumbs up because in the end, I enjoyed playing it and it gave me about 12 hours of entertainment which is all that matters. However, I wouldn't pay full price for it.

I would say that if you are looking specifically for a hospital game and can pick it up cheaply then do so but if you're looking for a sim / tycoon / management game in general and don't mind the genre then give it a miss as there are much better ones out there.

reviewText:
It's as if Theme Hospital and [a paired-down version of] The Sims had a bit of a romance and then this popped out!
Therefore, a lovely little bit of reminiscence [with a twist!] for those of us craving a Theme Hospital fix, with a lil extra cherry on top!
I don't know if it's just nostalgia, but I think I do still consider Theme Hospital the better [more polished] of the two [still available on GOG.com I think?]...... but this is a refreshing [yet still pretty retro!] lil take on that previous classic, with some added soap opera drama thrown in!

PROS: Great for re-living the classic but with a 'fresh' new angle and visuals [You even get fresh new silly/fun-style diseases and illnesses to treat in the style of TH!]
Campaign mode has a pretty daft/humorous [yet strangely entertaining!] soap opera style storyline to keep the ball rolling through the levels/challenges
Nice to have the chance to experience the Theme Hospital genre through a more '3D' world this time!
Still retains the feel of a very highly customisable building experience [I know *I* have a bit of an obsession with layouts and colour schemes for laying out and organising these sorts of places, so any others of you who do too will be glad to know there's plenty of capability, considering this is still a fairly retro-ish game]
Whilst I didn't go all out on exploring this aspect, I thought it was pretty cool that you can actually control/micromanage the staff and affect their inter-staff relations and actions, live!


CONS: The camera angles at times are just INFURIATING! [e.g. when you need to pan down to the bottom of the aerial view 'map' of the hospital to be able to see where you can fit a new room, there are serious issues with being able to see to the edges. NB: This *can* sometimes be 'remedied' by rotating the camera around a few times - but that is only SOMETIMES!] Basically, if you are the kinda person to flip-tables and rage-quit over this sorta stuff, maybe it's best steering clear - for your own sanity ;P [personally, I soldiered on patiently...but it was still fairly painful at times :P]
Depends on your humour: if you can't stand lame [meant to be self-affacing I think] jokes or cheesy parodying then maybe this isn't for you either! [I just kinda went with it, rolling my eyes to myself...by the end I actually produced a chuckle now and then...what has happened to me?!? hahlp.]
And of course, the graphics are very dated and the character models/animation a bit awkward...but hey, that's to be expected right?
Some could criticise it for being just a Theme Hospital clone"
recommended: it kinda is. [But what's wrong with that
hoursPlayed: when it's also ADDING to the previous style with some of the fun new bits and bobs mentioned above?]\n\nOverall
voteText: I picked this up for something like 89p if I remember correctly... And I *certainly* got well over 89p's-worth of value out of it! It was possible to sink a good few hours into this game and thoroughly enjoy the experience.\nPick yourself up a copy next time it's on sale
helpfulPercent: and surprise yourself with how much you can actually still enjoy a game that's pretty rough around the edges in places

reviewText:
It's not Theme Hospital but it tries hard to be and succeeds mostly.  So far I am on Season 3 Episode 3 and am enjoying it in story mode.  It's not nearly as hard as Theme Hospital is.  However the only thing I can 100% guarantee you will want to do is turn off the sound.  When they talk it's the Sims gibberish and it just repeats over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over...

The graphics are not quite up there with Theme Hospital either but that is because Theme Hospital was Sprites while this went with a very early 3d model engine.  So the 3d models are not nearly as detailed or look as good as the sprites do.

Overall I am quite enjoying my time with it.  Is it the classic that Theme Hospital is? Nope.  But it's a fun little romp through a soap opera Theme Hospital wannabe.

reviewText:
This is probably one of the worst games I've ever played and is really showing it's age (released in 2007), but that's not the reason why I dislike it. I dislike this game, because the hospital in this game doesn't even look like a hospital. It's like a mix between a very small airport, a medical practice and a train station which has severe funding issues (but I guess funding issues come down to if you actually play this game or not).

The storyline is extremely short and is poorly written, and has nothing to do with running a hospital. There are more doctors and nurses in the 'hospital' than there are actual patients. I don't really mind the poor graphics due to how old this game is. The AI's who work at the 'hospital' don't do their jobs (as designed). Quite a few of the patients which had been admitted, died while either using the restroom or died on the way to get treated. I understand that the AI are poorly written and this game was released in 2007, but there have been other games that were released in 2007 which were no where near this level of awfulness. This game isn't unplayable but you probably won't enjoy it.

Even though I received this game in a Humble Bundle, simply put, please don't buy this. It's not worth the money and effort to install even if you got it for a relatively good price. If you do end up purchasing this game, you'll probably end up requesting a refund from Steam.

I rate this game (based on my experience of 20 minutes) - 1/10.

reviewText: If you want to run a Hospital get Theme Hospital instead. This game is very similar with less controls. With TH you get to increase pay wages and control heating and money spent on researching cures and some random challenges within the game mode. This game has ZERO controls involved. All you get to do is build rooms, hire/fire staff and decorate the hospital and nothing else. I would prefer a hospital game where I can control staff hours, wages, the types of tasks they can perform, break times, charges for each treatment per doctor. I would also make it more realistic and include plastic surgery and post surgery recovery time spent in the hospital bed. Throw in a cafe, job posting where I can list tasks, work schedule and skill requirements just to add more to the game. If this game is offered to you for FREE then take it but don't waste the money on this game. You won't play it very much.

reviewText:
I've heard good things about this game and really love management sims, so I played the Story mode to learn how to play the game and I have to say the mechanics are certainly one of the best features of this game.

The writing of the story itself is pretty poor, but this game doesn't take itself seriously. The story is done by a scrolling text on the bottom of the screen which sometimes changes too quickly to read, and there is no voice acting in terms you'd expect. Instead they use a technique similar to Simlish so the game can be played in multiple languages. However, story mode is but a tutorial and the game seems well rounded in terms of mechanics and animation.

There are several aspects to the game mechanics and running a successful hospital hinges on being able to provide enough staff and equipment to deal with the influx of patients without going into the red, as well as keeping everyone happy. Happiness is determined by how much decoration is placed and there were times where it felt more like Interior Design Tycoon". It's fairly easy as management sims go
date:
but still enjoyable.

I especially enjoyed discovering new diseases and putting new systems in place to treat them. The diseases are shown on collectible cards which show info on examination and treatment procedures. They are collected by researching someone with an unknown disease.

Overall this game is great if you're looking for a management sim."

reviewText:
Hospital Tycoon is not as good as the 10 year older Theme Hospital.

The story mode has an awfully written story. It is supposed to be made like a drama, but the whole story arc is shallow and just bad. The graphics are the strongest point of this game, despite weird animations.

There are some crucial programming errors like pathing problems (Receptionists not doing their job and patients dying in the rest room) and script errors in the story, where it is impossible to finish a level after missing an instruction.

There are no graphs at all, just some basic stats listed for your staff. This game should not even be named a Tycoon game.

To rebuke a few of the unhelpful reviews:
- You CAN change directions of items with < > keys.

- The patients are NOT treated in the pharmacy, they go through a series of medical examinations and various funny machines in the healing process (most of them ending in the pharmacy for some pills).

- The game DOES instruct you what to do if you play the campaign.

- The game is NOT hard if you have half a brain, and it's not rigged for you to lose. Burnt out people need to be treated fast (try putting more than one table in the physio department?).

reviewText:
I honestly adore tycoon and simulation games. I had a spare couple dollars and this was on sale a little while back so why not try it? Well... This is the only review I have written so far.

I have music playing, and the noises the receptionist or whatever she is was still annoying me. I just turned the sound off and that wasn’t an issue any more.

The thing that gets me about this game was the main story mode. Sexy male ab workout guy can’t marry the nurse because of his dedication to the job. What compelled them to do something like that in a tycoon game? It is just extremely awkward especially for this kind of game.

On a side note, I wish some of this stuff was cured in one doctor visit.

reviewText:
A funny game that is a great remake of the orignal game.

It is funny and entertaining.

Don't expect a super-serious sim, this is for entertainment. It is hilarious sometimes even.

I loved the original Hospital tycoon, and this version is a great update both graphically and depth.

It is still a small game and should cost you more than 5$... I got it on sale at 1.25$ I think.

If you want to laugh while playing a little business sim, go ahead and buy this one, unlike some other bigger budget games, it is quite stable and bug-free.

voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Brought this game on the steam sale for 0.69 and I would recommend at that price but no more.
I brought it because I miss Theme Hospital and was hoping for something a little like that. What I got was a game similar to Theme hospital in that I can hire and fire staff and they treat the sickly that come into your hospital and thats where the similarities end.
It wasn't a bad game for the price but I am not recommending it at any other price.

Short and restrictive
It's set as some sort of mock on a hospital drama sitcom thing, it trys to be funny but it really isnt.
the story line is boring and ends up being skipped  to get to the actual game play but that also isn't overly fun, but it kills time.
You can pick from a small selection of preset sized rooms to use for your treatments you cant change sizes.
You can't make your hospital bigger.
Don't get used to the layout you may have created while in story mode, each episode" erases what you have done anyway.

Its ok at 69pence but a rip off for anything higher.
"

reviewText:
I'm personally enjoying this game very much. I remember playing Theme Hospital on my PS1 and I couldn't stop playing it - rather addictive in my experience. The gameplay remains the same as its predecessor, but now there's more social interactions between sims... and DRAMA! It's not as modern as you'd expect it to be (graphics, controls, etc.), so if you aren't a 90's kid, I don't recommend it for you.

For a  90's kid (and below), the graphics and loading won't disturb you as much. I love the scenarios they've added in-game, which only brings out the inner child in me. Way to go back to the past!

7.5/10

reviewText:
This game has numerous problems, it's mechanics are barely functional.
It feels like it wasn't play tested for more than a couple hours.
Yeah it's a nostalgia cash grab for Theme Hospital, and it's evident within the first 10 minutes that it falls flat on its ♥♥♥♥.

So many game mechanics that logically would require 1 click, actualy require 3 or more, which makes playing it tedious, and slows down the overall pace of the game.

Then there's silly(er) things like the HUD blocking where you want to click.
Controls are awkward.

AI is non existant. Patients will hang around waiting for doctors/nurses or equipment to be free so they can get tested. Even though everyone/thing is idle.

On the plus side, there aren't any stability bugs. No crashes. That's how low the bar Codemasters set before they released this game.

reviewText:
Overview: Hospital Tycoon is a game in which you run a hospital that you recently overtook. There isnt really much to say, the entire gameplay is in the game.

Pros:
I've got nothing.

Cons:
Feels like a rip off of an old game called Theme Hospital. Same idea of building hospital rooms and making your hospital better, however it seems less well implimented. When you complete an episode" (which follows tired hospital drama tropes)
date: all your progress is reset and new stuff is put in place instead.\nFollowing the last con
recommended: the game doesnt give you a sense of doing anything. Anything you accomplished in the last episode like building a new opperation room over the windows because why not is gone in the next episode.\nThe whole episode thing in general. The episodes are too short for me to like them as a feature. If the episodes were longer than like.... 10 minutes
hoursPlayed: it'd be good.\n\nFor a game that tries hard to be a ~*cool hospital drama*~ it even fails at that mark
voteText: making it a bland game to play. I'm surpised I managed to put as long as I did into it. If my purchase of this game hadnt of gone to charity I'd want a refund."

reviewText: Witty and funny storyline! It's a simple tycoon type of game, and easy to get into. I'd recommend it to any tycoon gamer! It doesn't require tons of micro-management and specifics to enjoy this game.

reviewText: I've read the negative reviews, so I lowered my expectation and bought it on sale. I thought it would just be similar to the hospital (doctor career) in The Sims 4, but this game is even slower (very awkward control, indeed) and I hate it when I lost my modified room in the next episode. The only cool thing in this game is the first person view. The drama is horrible (trying to be Grey's Anatomy, but...). That's it. I can't even force myself to play for 2 hours.

reviewText:
This game has numerous problems, it's mechanics are barely functional.
It feels like it wasn't play tested for more than a couple hours.
Yeah it's a nostalgia cash grab for Theme Hospital, and it's evident within the first 10 minutes that it falls flat on its ♥♥♥♥.

So many game mechanics that logically would require 1 click, actualy require 3 or more, which makes playing it tedious, and slows down the overall pace of the game.

Then there's silly(er) things like the HUD blocking where you want to click.
Controls are awkward.

AI is non existant. Patients will hang around waiting for doctors/nurses or equipment to be free so they can get tested. Even though everyone/thing is idle.

On the plus side, there aren't any stability bugs. No crashes. That's how low the bar Codemasters set before they released this game.

reviewText: It's an older game, so I was willing to give it the benefit of the doubt, but it didn't grab my attention.  The character models are pretty ugly, and the muzak is mind numbing.  Everyone speaks an off brand version of the Sims language, but it's repetitive and annoying instead of charming.  The jokes are all tired parodies of hospital dramas like ER.\n\nTry Roller Coaster Tycoon instead.
